question: Carl watches TV after he finishes his homework every night. On Tuesday and Wednesday, he watched a 4-hour episode of his favorite show each night. On Thursday, he watched a few episodes of a 60-minute show. On Friday, he finished homework early and watched a 4-hour episode and a 15-minute show. On Saturday, he got to stay up late, so he watched two 2-hour episodes. If he watched 20 hours of TV in all, how many 60-minute episodes did he watch on Thursday?
answer:
Let E be the number of episodes he watched on Thursday.
After Tuesday, he had 20 - 4 = <<20-4=16>>16 hours of TV left.
After Wednesday, he had 16 - 4 = <<16-4=12>>12 hours of TV left.
After Friday, he had 12 - 4 - 0.25 = 7.75 hours of TV left.
After Saturday, he had 7.75 - 4 = 3.75 hours of TV left.
Each 60-minute episode is 1 hour.
Thus, E = 3.75/1 = 3.75 episodes.
#### 3.75
